page.title: 03Dumfries Fire Station
page.content: Dumfries fire station was opened on the 28th November 1958. Dumfries and Galloway fire brigade covers a 9 mile radius and fifteen retained stations cover the rest of Galloway. In Dumfries they have a water ladder, water tender, turntable ladder and emergency ladder. Dumfries fire station is becoming more sophisticated because of the Euro-route between Ireland and Europe. Each fire appliance holds a maximum of 300 gallons of water, which does not go very far. The average number of calls a year is around 2000. There are 17 men on a shift. After an incident a report is written out. Each person has his own locker. Also in the station they have a dormitary, mess room, lecture hall, kitchen, control room and a smoke chamber and tower.
